    • Method Detail

      • getClients

        public java.util.List<GameClientHandler> getClients()

      • run

        public void run()
        Continuously waits for a socket willing to connect. Opens the In- and OutputStreams if a socket is accepted. Does the handshake with the client, calls for a new GameClientHandler and possibly start a game with 2 GameClientHandlers.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • setup

        public void setup​(int port)
        Sets up a server socket on the given port number.
        Parameters:
        port - Port to which the server is listening

      • handshakeToAll

        public void handshakeToAll​(java.lang.String message)
        calls all GameClientHandlers to send out a given message.
        Parameters:
        message - to be sent

      • sendTimeUpdate

        public void sendTimeUpdate​(int seconds,
                           GameController gameController)
        calls the SendToGameClients method with a time update (Message according to the protocol).
        Parameters:
        seconds - seconds left in the game
        gameController - Controller of the game of which the Time update must be sent.

      • sendTurnIndicator

        public void sendTurnIndicator​(GameController game)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        calls the SendToGameClients method with a turn indicator (Message according to the protocol).
        Parameters:
        gameController - controller of the game of which the turn indicator must be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if IO error occurs

      • SendTogameClients

        public void SendTogameClients​(java.lang.String msg,
                              GameController gameController)
        Calls all the GameClientHandlers connected to the game to send a message over their sockets.
        Parameters:
        msg - message that needs to be sent
        gameController - Controller of the game that needs a to send a message to their clients.

      • handshakeMessage

        public java.lang.String handshakeMessage​(java.lang.String name)
        Parameters:
        name - name of the newly connected GameClientHandler
        Returns:
        the handshake message according to the protocol

      • handshakeMessage

        public java.lang.String handshakeMessage​(java.lang.String name1,
                                         java.lang.String name2)
        Parameters:
        name1 - name of the GameClientHandler waiting for a game to start.
        name2 - name of the newly connected GameClientHandler
        Returns:
        the handshake message according to the protocol

      • nameAvailable

        public boolean nameAvailable​(java.lang.String name)
        checks if a name is not already used by a different GameClientHandler
        Parameters:
        name - name that needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if name is not used already.

      • sendStart

        public void sendStart​(GameController game)
               throws java.io.IOException
        calls the GameClientHandlers connected to the GameController to send a message over their sockets to indicate that the game has started.
        Parameters:
        game - gameController of the game of which the start message must be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if IO error occurs
